title: [Feat]: Better options for focusing
body:
### Describe the feature

Ability to hide message notifications, unread message count

### Motivation

There are already some very nice options for disabling notifications:

- Disable all notifications
- Disable meeting notification
- Disable notifications sound
- Disable sound when not available (e.g. busy, in a call)
- Disable window flash on new notifications

I would like two additional options:

- Hide unread message count: Sometimes I need to really focus, and the message notifications can be really distracting. Even the unread message count can be difficult to ignore when I need to focus on something difficult but my brain wants an excuse to do something else :)
- Disable message notifications: Similar to disable meeting notifications, however I typically want the opposite; I don't want to hide meeting notifications because I don't want to miss a meeting, but message notifications can be frequent and disatracting

Beyond this, I think it's great that that there's an option to _Disable sound when not available_. However, why is this the only option that applies when not available? I would like this ability for all of the options. However, with the current UX this would result in duplicating all of the options, e.g.

- Disable meeting notifications
- Disable meeting notifications when not available
- Disable notifications sound
- Disable notifications sound when not available
- Disable window flash on new notifications
- Disable window flash on new notifications when not available

Rather than duplicating all of these options, what if this was made a separate option, such as:

- Only disable notifications when not available

Then it could be applied to all.

So my final proposal would be something like:

- Disable all notifications
- Disable meeting notifications
- Disable message notifications
- Disable notification sound
- Disable window flash on new notifications
- Hide unread message count
- Only apply these settings when not available (e.g. busy, in a call)

What do you think?

I would be happy to work on a PR for any or all of this functionality.

Thanks!
